contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|HMS Theseus}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[Image:HMSTheseus1897.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag=[[Image:Naval Ensign of the United Kingdom.svg|60px|Royal Navy Ensign]] |Ship class= |Ship name=HMS ''Theseus'' |Ship ordered= |Ship awarded= |Ship builder=[[Thames Ironworks and Shipbuilding Company]] |Ship laid down=16 July 1890 |Ship launched=8 September 1892 |Ship christened= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=14 January 1896 |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship captured= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship fate=Sold for breaking up 8 November 1921 |Ship status= |Ship homeport= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship displacement=7,350 tons |Ship length={{convert|387.5|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|60|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draught={{convert|23|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= |Ship propulsion=Four boilers, two cylinder vertical triple expansion engines, two shafts 12,000 hp (8.9 MW) |Ship speed=20 knots |Ship range=10,000 nautical miles (19,000 km) at 10 knots (19 km/h) |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship complement=544 |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=2 x [[BL 9.2 inch gun Mk III - VII|BL {{convert|9.2|in|mm|sing=on|sigfig=4}} guns]]<br> 10 x [[QF 6 inch Mk I - III naval gun|QF {{convert|6|in|mm|sing=on|sigfig=4}} guns]]<br> 12 x 6pdr guns<br> 5 x 3 pounder (1.4 kg) guns<br> 4 x 18 in (457 mm) submerged torpedo tubes |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMS ''Theseus''''' was an [[Edgar class cruiser|''Edgar''-class]] [[protected cruiser]] of the [[Royal Navy]]. The ''Edgars'' were basically smaller versions of the [[Blake class cruiser|''Blake'' class]]. ''Theseus'' was launched at [[Leamouth]], [[London]] in 1892 and commissioned on 14 January 1896. Upon commission, she was part of the [[Special Flying Squadron]]. She was a tender ship to [[HMS Cambridge (shore establishment)|''Cambridge'']] from 1905 to 1913. In February 1913, ''Theseus'' joined the [[Queenstown, Ireland|Queenstown]] Training Squadron. When war broke out in 1914, ''Theseus'' joined the [[10th Cruiser Squadron]]. On 14 October, ''Theseus'', accompanied by her sister-ship [[HMS Hawke (1891)|HMS ''Hawke'']], were patrolling the [[North Sea]] when they were attacked by [[Unterseeboot 9 (1910)|U-9]]. The submarines first torpedo missed ''Theseus'' but hit ''Hawke'', igniting a magazine that caused a tremendously powerful explosion, that ripped much of the ship apart. Just 70 of her 594 crew survived. ''Theseus'' was rearmed, along with bulges to her hull, which were added to enable her to take part in the [[Dardanelles Campaign]]. In 1916 she was deployed to the [[Mediterranean]] and was then sent to the [[White Sea]]. In 1918 she was sent to the [[Aegean Sea]] to be charged with the mundane task of being a [[depot ship]]. In 1919, ''Theseus'' had her final deployment, when she was sent to the [[Black Sea]]. She returned to the [[United Kingdom|UK]] in 1920 and was scrapped the following year in Germany. ==References== *{{Colledge}} * Roger Chesneau and Eugene M. Kolesnik, ed., ''Conway's All The Worlds Fighting Ships, 1860â€“1905'', (Conway Maritime Press, London, 1979), ISBN 0-85177-133-5 {{Edgar class cruiser}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Theseus (1892)}} [[Category:Edgar-class cruisers]] [[Category:Leamouth-built ships]] [[Category:Victorian-era cruisers of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:World War I cruisers of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:1892 ships]]
